answers.answer: You only need these glasses for distance such as driving or the movies.Brightness and contrast is a personal preference.Dr. O.

Thanks Ray.. I am comfortable with the screen settings, it doesn't bother me that much but since the day i know my eyes it remain little red throughout the day and gets more red when i take a shower. Do I have a problem or it is a kind of eyes that i have. One more question, what is the expected rate of increase of points, my doc said this will not change for 10yrs and i have a prescription that is valid for a yr only.
No one can predict the amount of change in prescription.  Redness usually has a cause.  See an EyeMD.Dr. O.

I see that you are a frequent contributor to this very helpful eye care forum.  I appreciate your dedication, and I am sure many other people are also deeply appreciative of your help.  Kudos to you good Doctor!From Ian Harlen of the damaged cornea question.

question: How to use the glass?Details about my eye..- I am 31 yrs.- spend 12 hrs a day in front of laptop- workout 4 days a week, no high blood pressure, no diabetes- Left is the lazy eye- OD: -0.75, OS: -0.5How often should I use the glass and what is the monitor lighting requirement? I am currently using 75% brightness and 65% contrast.
title: Wearing Glasses Instruction
